Take the step to a bright future. From requirements and deadlines to cost of attendance and visits to America’s most beautiful campus, we make it easy to apply to Rollins’ traditional full-time undergraduate day programs in the College of Liberal Arts.
U.S. News & World Report has ranked Rollins the top regional university in the South in its 2020 rankings of “Best Colleges.”
Explore everything from our lakeside location to our intimate, personalized learning environment and find out why Rollins consistently ranks among the nation’s top college campuses.
Rollins has been named to Money.com’s list of the nation’s best colleges for merit aid, ranking in the top 50 for access to merit-based financial aid.
From our curriculum to career services, find out how Rollins prepares our graduates to lead meaningful lives and forge productive careers.
Learn why Rollins is right for you

A top-ranked academic program featuring individualized attention from award-winning faculty and staff. A picturesque lakeside location with weather that is so consistently beautiful, classes are often held outdoors. Rollins offers its students all this and much more in a nurturing, vibrant environment dedicated to empowering our graduates to pursue meaningful lives and productive careers.
From our top-ranked academics to the hundreds of ways to get involved, take a closer look at the Rollins experience.
Stay up to the minute on key upcoming deadlines.
Fall Semester Admission for Transfer Applicants

When Florida needed a college, we founded one. We’re entrepreneurial like that. More than 130 years later, we’re still hard at work, preparing a new generation of leaders to meet the challenges of the 21st century.
Live, study, and flourish in Rollins’ innovative learning community and develop the expertise to                   succeed                   as the world evolves.
Earn your bachelor’s or master’s degree with the flexibility of a nontraditional program at                   Rollins’                   Hamilton Holt School.
Advance your career with MBA, Executive DBA, and continuing education programs at Rollins’ Crummer                   Graduate School of Business.
